4iʿlānāt:
- maṭbaʿa al-fayḥāʾ in Damascus: for tables and notebooks (dafātir) for the administration etc. In Arabic, Turkish, Persian, and foreign languages. stamping facilities, etc. medium prices. proprietor: <persName>Muṣṭafā Shūrā</persName>
-maṭbaʿa dimashq: a new printing press for movable letters and lithography was established under this name in the second storey of Khān al-Jadīd in Sūq Midḥat Pasha. Will print every order in the two languages Arabic and French at hight quality and a low price. proprietor: <persName>Fahmī Shūrā</persName>

1al-rutab wa al-baladiyya by Shukrī al-ʿAsalī.
al-Muqtabas joined the choir, when newspapers in Constantinople pointed at the ranks that compromise (afsadat) the morals of the nation (akhlāq al-umma). various papers, including Muqtabas, Lisān al-Ḥāl etc. called for the abolition of ranks, as did the MPs (nuwwāb al-umma), so that all people (al-nās) will be Efendis and no one will remain a Pasha or Bey, as these ranks were the last remnant of the corruption of the morals of the populace (akhlāq al-shaʿb)
…
"My brothers, people of my town (ahl baladī), you are free! Think yourselves about your own affairs! Watch your own benefits! And elect those who protect your safety and health.
…
Don't be afraid." ...

3hd: received a letter from "the lover of the truth" (muḥabbi al-ḥaqq) that the tramway company commenced cutting down walnut trees along the Ṣāliḥiyya Road without prior consent of the owners. but the law requires that the company establishes the value of the trees through experts, to pay this price to the owners, and then start cutting them down.
hd: at Sancaḳdār road there are trenches / holes along both sides of the tramway track and we don't know whether the company or the municipality to fill these holes. Be it as it may those responsible should immediately fill these traps for pedestrians and coaches, which are particularly dangerous at night time.
3f
hd: dialogue between a rich and a poor man by Muḥī al-Dīn Ṣādiq
- poor: how do you view my rights and your rights, these days?
- rich: how can my rights and your rights be different?
- p: oh, brother I heard that our rights became the same and your answer contravenes this
- r: how can that be, as I am the owner of fortunes and who are you?...

1fal-ʿArab maʿ al-turk / Arabs and Turks
2hd: the refugees commission in the province received £T 5.000 from the agricultural bank in istanbul
2hd: on differences/ problems of the Ḥijāz railway company: the last prove needed is the way they fail to deal with the estimated 6.600 Caucasian pilgrims who will arrive shortly in Damascus to take the train to Medina
3hd: yest, arrival of the Vali, Nāẓim Pasha, from Jerusalem were he went because of the civil strife (fitna) between the Bedouins (ʿarab) and the Greek Orthodox.
3hd: police announced that the arrested a burglar who had broken into the house of <persName>Malik bin Ḥasan Mirzā Khān</persName>, the Iranian consul
4the povince had ordered all administrative divisions to observe that their officials are present at the offices between 5 and 11 o'clock.

al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

2 four articles of the Ottoman-Austrian convention drawn up on 5 Ṣaf by the Austrian ambassador to Constantinople, and Ghabrīl Efendi, minister of trade and public works.
3the ministry of war established new salaries according to rank from Ps 1.250 for a Binbaşi down to 240 for the assistant of the battalion scribe and from Ps 12.500 for a Mushīr , 7.000 for a first-class general, etc. down to the ḳaymaḳam at Ps 1.500.
3 proceedings of the Greek Orthodox Ladies' society in Damascus
3results of the municipal elections in Damascus [total number of votes = 7397]. the following nobles were elected:
- to the first level [total of 4956]: <persName>Aḥmad Bey Mardam Bek</persName> (744), <persName>Maḥmūd Efendi al-Khūja</persName> (507), <persName>ʿĀrif Efendi al-Qudsī</persName> (460), <persName>ʿAbdallah Efendi al-Kuzbirī</persName> (436), <persName>Aḥmad Bey Ajalyaqīn</persName> (424), <persName>Kamāl Efendi al-Yāsīnī</persName> (391), <persName>ʿAṭā Bey al-ʿAḍma</persName> (372), <persName>ʿUthmān Āğā al-Simān</persName> (357), <persName>Maḥmūd Pasha Būẓū</persName> (345), <persName>ʿAṭā Pasha al-Bakrī</persName> (345), <persName>Shākir Efendi Ḥamza</persName> (299), <persName>ʿAlī Bey Būẓū</persName> (276).
- to the second level [total of 2441]: <persName>Nasīb Bey Ḥamza</persName> (260), <persName>Musallam Efendi al-Ḥuṣnī</persName> (257), <persName>Aḥmad Efendi al-Dālānī</persName> (210), <persName>Yahyā Efendi al-Ṣawwāf</persName> (201), <persName>Salīm Efendi Qassāb Ḥasan</persName> (200), <persName>Ibrāhīm Āğā Ḥabbāb</persName> (198), <persName>ʿAlī Āğā al-ʿAsalī</persName> (197), <persName>Khalīl Āğā Shaʿlān</persName> (196), <persName>Kamāl Efendi al-Qaḍamānī</persName> (186), <persName>Kamāl Efendi al-Ḥalabī</persName> (181), <persName>Muḥammad Efendi ʿArabī Kātib</persName> (180), <persName>Zakkī Efendi al-Muhāyinī</persName> (175).
- the lists have been forwarded to the province and the Vali to appoint a president from the first level. But not the Muslims (ghayr al-muslimīn) as none of them could reach the majority of votes due the majority of their voters/candidates having being withdrawn from/by the electoral committee. this is again due to the well-known traitors (jawāsīs) in the old administration who only seek their own profit.
4iʿlān: announcement for "national school" (maktab al-waṭan) opened four months ago in al-Baḥṣa al-Juwwāniyya for the education of the children of the nation (awlād al-waṭan). fee of Frcs 4. signed by the director Monsieur George
4iʿlān for the new hotel (lūkanda) "al-Madīna al-Munawwara" in Bāb al-Jābiyya close to the Sūq Midḥat Pasha. 3 storeys, with rooms (maḥallāt) and suites (dawāʾir khuṣūṣiyya) for travellers and their families. clean and modern. know numerous languages, signed by the proprietor <persName>Ṣāliḥ al-Bakrī</persName>
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

1hd: report on the funds for the ʿAyn Fīja water project between 5 Kan I 1319 until end of Shub 1324. The mecidiye being computed at Ps 19.
- listing the various sources: tax on petrol and alcohol, the meat tax (iʿāne al-laḥm) of annually Ps 826.539"05, etc.
2hd: proceedings of the general council (majlis ʿumūmī) of 4 Mārt. concerning various medicine-related topics: certificates, 5 municipal doctors will supervise orderly burials and issue certificates of death. etc. four dispensaries to be established ( one each in Shāghūr, ʿĀmara, Mīdān, and Ṣāliḥiyya)
3hd: various letters to Ṣabbāḥ: on the Bedouin rascals (ashqiyā) in Bosra
- Sunday night, 8 o'clock, five people, of whom only <persName>Ibrāhīm al-Kurdī al-Mārdīnī</persName> is known, went to the Marja, where a quarrel (munāzaʿa) occurred between them injuring Ibrāhīm. he was then treated at the Ghurabāʾ hospital, and the others were arrested
- admin council had ordered the removal of the zinc barrier [al-ḥājiz al-tawtiyā] leading from front of the al-ʿābid commercial building to the baladiyya in order to ease the way for pedestrians in this narrow quarter caused by the tramway stops. until not yet approved.
- tonight an Egyptian troupe will play at the theater of the dār al-iṣlāḥ (explicitly explained as iṣlāhḫāne), among the actors is <persName>Ibrāhīm Efendi Sāmī</persName>
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

1-2"al-madrasa" by Rabīʿ
2-3proceedings of the senate
3 address by ʿAbdülhamid II to the Senate and the lower house
3hd: the general council formed a commission under the presidency of the Vali – leading merchants and dignitaries are the members – to convince the people (ahālī) of wearing national textiles (mansūjāt waṭaniyya)
- <persName>Maḥmūd Pasha Būẓū</persName> resigned and is replaced by his son <persName>ʿAlī Bey Būẓū</persName> as member of the baladiyya, due to having won the most votes
- yesterday met the [new] baladiyya and various members had to be newly appointed as at least three elected members had other business
- theatre: a troupe of most excellent actors and agents of the Syrian Nahḍa performed the play fatāh al-dustūr at the Zahra Dimashq theatre. longer description of the performance, NOT READ
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

1hd: arrivals in the Ḥijāz railway related that <persName>Muḥammad Khūrshīd Efendi</persName>, railway official from Maʿān and Darʿā, threw a Chinese Shaykh and his wife off the train, who were on their return from the Ḥajj. He was trying to charge them ever increasing fares, which they couldn't pay. this is common practice with the pilgrims
hd: violent quarrel between<persName> ʿAbduh al-Māliḥ</persName> and <persName>Muḥammad al-Māliḥ</persName> on the one side and <persName>Zakkī al-Jiyān</persName> and <persName>Ḥasan al-Jadiyya</persName> on the other in Sūq al-Surūjiyya. Drew fire arms and shot at each other. the bullets hit the guard of the quarter, <persName>Mūsā bin Ibrāhīm</persName> in the face, who was seriously wounded and taken to the Ghurabāʾ hospital. search for the perpetrators began. <persName>ʿAbd al-Laṭīf al-Māliḥ</persName> was arrested, who had witnessed the crime.
1f.Beirut and Damascus, by F.Gh. from ʿAyntāp: in the age of tyranny (zaman al-istibdād) Beirut supplied the Arab lands (al-buldān al-ʿarabiyya) with enlightening books, newspapers, etc. opened libraries and publishing houses …
2hd: heard from the general council that the curricula of the ibtidāʾiyya schools will be reformed to improve the future of the country. training will be entirely in Arabic at the ibtidāʾiyya level, while at rüşdiye and iʿdādiye schools parts of the curriculum will be taught in Turkish.
the director of education had prepared a reform agenda (lāʾiḥa) couched in language of somebody who doesn't no local affairs (man lā yaʿrifu ḥājāt al-bilād), even though he lived here for 13 years.
thanking the council for the reform of the ibtidāʾiyya schools
hd: the baladiyya finished selecting its officials and it's going to dispatch them to work without respect for intercession (i.e. corruption.
hd: some of the intellectuals had argued that heads of municipalities and their members should …
hd: ʿAbd al-Raḥmān Bey al-ʿAẓm arrived from Constantinople
hd: the medical / doctors' club: correcting errors in the report of their constitution in Muqtabas 8
hd: tonight the Egyptian troop will stage the story of Muḥammad ʿAlī Pasha of Egypt at the theatre of the dār al-iṣlāḥ, called "iṣlāḥkhāne". will be played by Ibrāhīm Efendi Sāmī

hd: the director of the police forwarded an account of the police work between 22 Tish I 1324 and the end of Shubāṭ , 4 months and 8 days to the Vali: 1104 police / crime reports have been written in that time. including
– 1280 people of whom 789 have been arrested for injuring others. of the remaining 90 people were at large, sentenced in absentia
- 9 cases of murder, 5 have been arrested, the other 4 are hunted down
- 3 suicides
- 3 arrests of sought after murderers
- 13 arrests for sentenced criminals
- 186 arrested for diverting the works of the authorities, such as firing guns in the streets (aziqqa), engaging in masquerades in the theatres (duwar al-tamthīl) and thereby perverting public morals (al-ādāb al-ʿumūmiyya), quarrels (munāzaʿāt) <pb/> disturbing tranquility, owners of stores and cafés who ignored the official curfew.

Shukrī al-ʿAsalī: al-Baladiyya wa sharikat al-trāmwāy al-kahrabāʾī
- the people do not know how their rights (ḥuqūqahum) were lost between the baladiyya and the company, how the municipality sold public benefit (maṣlaḥa) and lost / abandoned the rights of the homeland (ḥuqūq al-waṭan)
- the baladiyya eases the live of the company with £T 3.000 per year, and this is not due to some squareheads in Istanbul, as argued, but to the dignitaries of the town, the heads and members of the municipality
- the director argues that he cannot do anything, but from the £T3 per light only 2 are spent on the lamp and the rest is profit.
- the company argues that these lights are for the benefit of the municipality, as they are lit after tramway services come to an end at 3 o'clock.
- but if it was for the municipality to decide and pay, it would not possibly chose to place the lamps for lighting the course of the tramway.
- proposes to separate these two kinds of lights for the purpose of establishing the real cost of street lighting to be levelled upon the municipality. we ask the municipality, and the heads working for the company, on behalf of Damascus and the Damascenes that increase of the £T3.000 was to be returned, and that the company stopped to feast on the rights of the baladiyya.
- the director argues that the company repaired the roads and thus supported the municipality. he should remember that the repair of roads is for the benefit of the company. I ask him: how could the company lay tracks on ruined streets?
- to the contrary. he is occupying general / public roads (al-ṭuruq al-ʿāmma), and encroaches upon the people (al-nās) and their movements. the stones he uses are the base for a business that endangers the health of the people (ṣaḥat al-ahālī). the stones for the road must be from solid granite, as other stones decay quickly and become sand that rises into the air, if the company doesn't sprinkle the roads. thus the air is polluted, and human (insān) health is corrupted.
- next issue is the relocation of graves and everything inside, which is straightforwardly wrong and ḥarām.
- I don't know how the company justifies operating summer coaches during the winter and I am not surprised by the gratitude of the director towards the Damascenes for supporting the benefit of the company.
- I equally expect from the municipality that it starts fulfilling its duties and tasks, and that the officials etc. do not just receive their salaries for nothing
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

1f: "Where is the municipality?" ayna al-baladiyya; by Rafīq
Damascus is one of the most important capitals of the Ottoman empire and destination of many foreigners and travellers who come here legally and illegally. a city like Damascus cannot cease its rights over the streets (niẓām al-shawāriʿ), their proper appearance and cleaning. it is strange that one tours the city or walks the streets <pb/>
the pedestrians are subjected to the drivers …
this is a blatant lack of diligence despite the existence of a municipality. how can it be that even a visitor from Cairo can see this and report on it? how can the members of the baladiyya not engage in the repair of streets which are jammed with coaches, such as the Darwīshiyya, Sūq al-Saʿādat, known as Sūq al-Ḥamīdiyya, Sūq Midḥat Pasha. regarding the latter two, the municipality claims a lack of sufficient funds as the reasons for the negligence. the merchants and shop owners commissioned the introduction of the street and the construction of sidewalks on both sides. they consider this beneficial work (al-ʿamal al-nāfiʿ) their responsibility

2hd: population statistics Tammūz: births: 72 boys, 65 girls; deaths: 70 men, 38 women; maktūmāt (hidden?): 42 men, 63 women
3hd: iẓhār ḥaqīqa; by Kāmil al-Bāsīnī
in reply to articles on the president of the municipality and its members, author indeed hopes that they keep their promises but provides a true insight into popular opinion (li-naẓr al-nās)
- the municipality claimed that the revenues for Ḥaz and Tam increased by some Ps 240.000 over the last year. how could that be?
1) the taxes on slaughtering, on qinṭār, the horse and donkey market were split between the treasury and the municipality until the end of Tish 1325. due to the efforts of the Vali Ismāʿīl Fāḍil Pasha, the MoF agreed to assign the entire amount to the baladiyya. this accounts for at least £T4.000 of the increase [here the author must be wrong, as £T 4.000 even as nominal value is far beyond the claimed increase of Ps 240.000]
2) the old baladiyya already collected some revenues for 1326, which account for £T1.000
when they draw up the budget for 1326, they assigned £T3.000 to roads. the amount was to be taken for the months Adhār, Nīsān, and Ayyār upon the ratification of the budget. the new municipality entered all the remaining cash from 1325 as revenues for the months of Ḥaz and Tam.
is the matter thus, or did the increase come from illegal sources, which will hurt the broadening of roads? we asked the municipal officials for a reply, but received no answer. therefore we ask, is it true, that Ps 11.443 in the municipal coffers came from real-estate owners along the Ṣāliḥiyya road or not? if this is the case, then it belongs to the actions of the last municipality.
this is the evil in all works meant to be of benefit for the town … the truth will be revealed at the end
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

3hd: verbatim quote from a letter from the municipality to the tramway and electric lighting company
- taking redress to the statutes of the company dated to 26 Shubāṭ 1307 and article 19 of the concession granted to the late Muḥammad Bey Arslān on the date of 3 Nīsān 1319 and 17 Kan I 1320.
- stipulating that the road from the Square of the government (Marja) to Bawābat Miṣr must be paved with stones as stipulated in article 9 of the regulations (shurūtnāme). but the company paved only a short section of the road with stones and the remainder between Sūq al-Ghanam to Bawābat Allah is made to match a light chaussee. there is no doubt on the difference between the two types of road concerning the dust (ghiyār) in summer and the conditions in winter.
- we thus issue a warning (ikhtār) to comply with the contract and pave the road with stones. if you do not comply with this warning the baladiyya will take redress to art 16 of the regulations and all costs incurred will be borne by you.
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

2hd: one cannot walk the streets and alleys of the city without seeing large piles of rubbish and filth emitting a strong smell. this is what the inhabitants see, but still they themselves throw the rubbish there. the municipal and health inspectors are nowhere to be seen, and meanwhile the people of cleanliness died within us (māt fīna khalq al-niẓāfa)
hd: the special directory of medical schools announced that it secured the entire funds for the reform/repair of the medical college for 1327 and sent them there.
hd: a troupe of artists and gymnasts arrived in Damascus and displays their show
hd: some people from Ṣāliḥiyya forwarded a petition (ʿarīḍa) to the province claiming that the tramway company commenced building a track to the quarter of al-Akrād only. the provincial administration council decided that the company has to build both tracks – from jisr al-abyaḍ to al-akrād and to al-muhājirīn – as previously agreed upon. the company has no choice as to comply, as the second line is of benefit for itself and the people
hd: the baladiyya supplied the ghurabāʾ pharmacy with a budget of Ps 8.000 which was supposed to go to the poor, but corruption creeped in and thus the regime was changed by the municipality and the provincial administration council to pay the bills of the pharmacy instead of supplying it with cash upfront
3hd: the price of wheat fell, and the kile of best quality is no Ps 48, the 2nd is Ps 40; barley is sold at Ps 19 to 22 due to the lack of demand for exports. reason for the falling price of wheat is the increase of supply inter alia from the Ḥawrān. some experts claim that without the current violence in the Ḥawrān, the price would be well below Ps 40. the Druze do not attack the railway stations and cereals transports due to their fear of fire arms…
hd: many ignorant people (kathīr min al-juhalāʾ) wear the attire of knowledge (ʿilm) and enter mosques for teachings and sermons, the two most important duties of Islam. the authorities (nāʾibs, MoI, imperial admin) established that no one is allowed to do so without a test and a permit
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

1Morals? al-Akhlāq? by R.B. from Salonica

hd: tomorrow the lists of those eligible to vote and be voted for for the baladiyya will be published. according to article 24 of the electoral laws, the lists will be posted for eight days. those who have objections and corrections can address them to the election committee during this time.
hd: the readers were informed that the price of wheat fell on account of abundant supplies, but the price of bread did not decrease accordingly. the baladiyya investigated the matter and called the on the mills and bakeries to gather today at the municipality to deliberate the issue. informed us that the price for bread will be Ps 3"30. call on the baladiyya to henceforth enforce these prices against the greedy bakers.
hd: the editor of al-Muntakhabāt, Adīb Efendi Naẓmī, retired after No.11 on account of bad health

3hd: the president of the baladiyya wrote the the head of the shūra al-dawla in the name of the Damascenes calling for an answer to his decision to cancel the contract for electric street lighting. As the company charges the people about 4 Riyāl (mecidiye) for a lamp per annum, while the municipality is under contract to pay £T 3. yet the concession states that it should pay only 40% less than the people (ahlīn).
the senate had deliberated on 25 Kan II 1325 … in regards to the municipalities of Constantinople and called for an annulment of the terms of the contract. with references to some articles of laws. this clearly also applies to Damascus and its public (ʿāmmat ahālī dimashq)

hd: lethal tramway accident in the Mīdān
after one o'clock last night an unknown young man from a village of whom is said that he is from the people of al-Muʿaẓama jumped from one tramway car to another in the quarter of Mīdān. his foot tripped and he fell between the two cars. when the driver stopped the cars after shouts from by-standers / eye-witnesses, they removed a lifeless body from between the cars.
jumping between cars is a dangerous custom and many people, particularly children can be seen doing it and not just along the Mīdān road. people have to understand and convince their children, that they have to abandon this custom
hd: open letter to the director of education in Syria
hd: short tractate on the issue of public roads and the Darwīshiyya by "al-Ḥārith bin Kalda"
"it hurst me when I see people walk on the pavement and the middle of the road" especially in the Darwīshiyya road, which is one of the most important streets of the town. the owners of cafés occupy the sidewalks and claim that the space between these is the road to be walked upon … petitions etc. such thing was surely written before the tramways began to operate and the baladiyya explicitly prohibited the appropriation of the road by private business

3hd: papers from the capital reported that the MoE informed the provincial directorates of education that Christian students in state / public schools (madāris amīriyya) are not forced to attend Islamic history
hd: we were ashamed by the appeal of the people (al-nās) to us when the baladiyya called on them to keep a general cleanliness (al-ṣaḥḥa al-ʿāmma). as if the city of Damascus was a chain of rubbish distributed along its general roads, squares, narrow alleys, and quarters (shawāriʿihā al-ʿāmma wa sāḥātihā wa aziqqatihā al-ḍayyiqa wa ḥārātihā), etc. Isn't it the foremost task of the baladiyya, its president, and its members to clean the town?
hd: received excerpts from the statues of the benevolent society (lajnat al-maqāṣid al-khayriyya) established by the CUP in Damascus for the education and feeding of the poor, and the support of the religious students.
also received the annual account of the Greek Orthodox society of St.Joh of Damascus (jamʿiyyat al-qadīs yūhanā al-dimashqī) established in 1883. commenced teaching poor children of the Greek Orthodox community in night schools. established a reading room in front of the Patriarchate4iʿlān: prices of cereals in Damascus

iʿlān by the tramway company on the tariffs; same as previous days

2hd: Sāmī Pasha commander of the Ḥawrān campaign issued a map / plan for 461km of chaussee roads to be built in the Ḥawrān
3hd: the provincial administration council replied to the decision made between the municipality and the tramway and electric lighting company that the baladiyya will pay £T3.500 for at least 2.500 lamps of 16 candela instead of 12 and the lighting of some official buildings (al-maḥāll al-rasmiyya). provincial administration council gave its approval since the State Council did not decided yet on the validity of the previous contract that stipulated that the baladiyya paid annually £T3.000 for 1.000 lamps for 99 years. therein the municipality implicitly accepted the obscene injustice upon the baladiyya and the town (al-balada), because the increase in lamps isn't real. but the customary price to be paid for the additional 1.500 lamps does not exceed £T0,5 per year in the countries that generate electricity from coal, not to mention that the company generates the power from the waters of Damascus. and the contract does not provide electric power to the offices of the police, gendarmerie, and the post whose workers work night and day. their is no doubt that they need light more than anybody else, and we want to hear the provincial administration council's opinion on this matter.the company … if the entire city was lit for £T 2.000 under contract, which is ratified by the state for 99 year. may the baladiyya look into this matter as we live in an age when the people account for …

3hd: reply to yesterday's report: the provincial administration council did not decide on the new contract between the municipality and the tramway and electric street light company but forwarded the terms to the State Council asking for recommendations concerning its information on annulment of the contract. a private letter had stated so, but the annulment was not official. thus the provincial administration council inquired again with the state council and the Damascene MP Rushdī Bey Shamʿa
hd: the president of the municipality informed that the charcoal acquired for the poor, which was distributed to some rich, made an inquire with the mukhtārs of the quarters. they claim that no one received anything beyond the amounts entered in the books. thus the baladiyya called on muqtabas to correct its reports. but the law requires that the mukhtārs are selected from the upright people etc., which is not the case. and it is necessary to sell the charcoal by the raṭl (i.e. in small quantities) in the quarters, as most of the poor cannot possibly afford a qinṭar at any given time
hd: "our friend" Fāris Efendi al-Khūrī entered the profession / was approved as lawyer
hd: baladiyya announced that camels carrying wood are only allowed to enter the town after sunset. and every three camels must have a driver.we call on the municipal bailiffs (jāwīsh) to enforce this order
4prices of foodstuffs
iʿlān by the president of the municipality, 22 TIsh II 1326: prohibiting the entry of camels carrying wood into the town before sunset. every three camels must have a driver. transgressions will be punished with a fee according to the law. this has been announced the all guilds of wood traders (li-ʿumūm aṣnāf bāʾiʿī al-akhshāb)
iʿlān: one can by the book "gharāʾib al-gharb" the wonders of the west at the offices of al-Muqtabas

hd: the charcoal issue; we published our convictions yesterday and call for a proper investigation by the baladiyya, that charcoal is only distributed to need poor and not the rich, as the latter seem to live from the poor despite reports and claims to the contrary

hd: by Fawzī, president of the municipality reply to no. 544
Muqtabas had reported that an expert (khabīr) had demanded that the municipality reviews / read the papers forwarded by the members concerning the distribution of charcoal to the poor. the expert had also claimed that large quantities were given to the wrong people. the contractor for the distribution was al-Ḥāj Ḥusayn al-Ḥalabī, who replied that every charcoal distributed in Damascus until today was given to the poor and the eligible needy only. Fawzī himself reviewed the lists provided by the members and found that not a single name of an undeserving person was found in them.
al-muqtabas: as long as the members of the baladiyya are good friends of the contract who distributes the charcoal to the poor, so long he will make a profit from it. (qawl kulli khaṭīb)

hd: yest; the rüşdiye in dūmā was inaugurated
hd: last night occurred a violent quarrel (nizāʿ) in Shāghūr on account of some women
at about half past eight six or seven person took stones (nazaʿū aḥjār) from the Ḥawsh al-Zayn in the Shāghūr quarter that houses some women and demanded entry but had flee due to the shouting and screaming of the neighbours. they were then chased by a patrol of policemen comprising the assistant superintendent of Shāghūr and two police officers and a patrol from Bāb al-Muṣallā, comprising an Onbaşı and four gendarmes. they were apprehended and arrested at the cemetery of Bāb al-Ṣaghīr. prior to the two patrols <persName>Salīm al-Ḥalabī</persName> one of the guards (ḥarrās) of Shāghūr went to the site of the incident and discovered and confiscated some firearms.

3hd: MoE to the province and the director of education asking him to supply information on necessary schools. he wrote that he needs to open two schools each, one for boys and one for girls, in the quarter of Ṣāliḥiyya and Mīdān. plus an ibtidāʾiyya in Ṣāliḥiyya, Mīdān, and Sūq Sārūjā for both boys and girls unlike the old schools.he plans to open 50 ibtidāʾī schools in the sancaks of Ḥawrān and Karak, and five in the sancak of Ḥamā.
needs a total of Ps 1.855.400, Ps 1.135.000 of which would be used for construction and repairs, Ps 242.500 for salaries. the difference of Ps 1.700 is for general purposes of the MoE in Syria
we ask the MoE to approve these plans
hd: yest the butchers of Damascus went on strike and stopped slaughtering lambs because the municipality required them to build glass counters and clean rails to hang the meat from. the majority of butchers protests this move as the cost of about Ps 1.000 per shop has to be borne by the shop owners. the municipality announced penalties for those not obeying the order, and the butchers argue that the municipality has to supply the tools if it makes such prescriptions.
the butchers addressed a petition to the province calling for an abolition of the slaughter tax, which, as they argue, should fund such a measure.
we call on the baladiyya to consider both the benefit of the butchers and the public (maṣlaḥat al-jazzārīn wa al-maṣlaḥat al-ʿāmma)

3hd: by Bāblī: it is no secret that Damascus is a city reforms and means governed by upright people in good clothes and from all quarters. they know everything about the filth and rubbish in the streets etc. and once they acquired all this knowledge they rush to their jobs and posts to quickly repair and maintain the affected street.
this honourable municipality issued a warning to the tramway company in al-Muqtabas 455 [sente:/BachBibliographie/muqtabas+168-eap] that it has to pave the road from the New Serai to Bawābat Miṣr with stones in accordance with article 9 of the statutes. it demanded the implementation of this decision with a public announcement (bi-lisān ʿāmmat al-ahalīn) in al-Muqtabas 529 [not in my database, should date to late november] and we are not informed about the results, even though this is matter is the most important and they are in the service of the homeland (al-khidmat al-waṭaniyya)

2hd: ḥadīth al-yawm: nothing happened to the Damascenes and their government but the death of the MP of Damascus [Muḥammad Efendi al-ʿAjalānī] and the differences with the Muftī of Damascus

4iʿlān: the tramway and electric lighting company has the honour to inform its honourable passengers that from the beginning of January 1911 the line to the Mīdān will be divided into two sections instead of three regarding the tariffs.
a) from the Serai to Suwayqa (the stop at the Jāmiʿ Jawbān Mosque): 1 metallik for the 2nd class and 2 metallik for the first class
b) from Suwayqa to the upper Mīdān: same tariff
the company also answers the calls of the people of Mīdān (ahālī al-mīdān),by creating a new leg between Bāb al-Jābiyya to the al-Jizmātiyya, enabling the people to commute between these points on a single fare.
iʿlān: the tramway and electric lighting company announces that holders of season passes have to renew their passes during the first eight days of January 1911 at the offices of the secretary (sikritīr) of the company, otherwise they will have to pay the regular fare.

2hd: last Thu: arrival of the new Vali ʿAlī Ghālib Bey by special train from Beirut. large reception at the Baramke station by a crowd of welcomers from all classes (bi-jumhūr al-mustaqbilīn min al-ahlīn ʿalā anuwāʿ ṭabaqātihim) and officials. a guard of honour of gendarmes and imperial soldiers with music, tens of policemen.
when the train arrived slightly late due to stops in Zabadānī and elsewhere, the music began to play and the people waved their arms. left the train with the deputy commander of the 5th army and went to station house to greet those present for the reception. salutes were fired and he went to the Serai, where he held a reception

1 "We and Europe"
1-2We and the municipalities, by Shaḥāda Jisr from Tiberias: in one of the numbers of muqtabas this issue was raised.
… it was announced to al-khāṣṣ wa al-ʿāmm that the municipalities were established for ordering and cleaning the streets.
it is true that this is one of the tools of establishing tranquility, but right now we only see cleaning efforts in some quarters in the vicinity of the house of the president, the rich (al-ghannī), or the ḥākim.
this is the truth and it is criticised by the journalists of all countries …
detailing the filth and the effects it has on the health of the people and the climate of the town
repairs and proper order (niẓām). but it seems that the baladiyyas adhere to special laws (niẓām khāṣṣ) not known to the rest.
the municipal law specifies that they appoint a special doctor to attend to the poor and to provide them with pharmacies.
the municipal law specifies that they inspect and protect the quality of food and drinks, but do we see anything of that?
the municipal law specifies to separate industries and living quarters, but to we hear of such policies beyond eminent critique?
the municipal law specifies that public fountains (marāḥīḍ ʿāmma) are built in the streets and quarters … but we only see how they fest on the money of the populace (amwāl al-shaʿb)
….
providing examples from New York

1-2incidents that happened to the former Vali of Syria, Ismāʿīl Fāḍil Pasha in Constantinople. information based on al-Muqattam
2-3hd: Rushdī Bey Shamʿa, our MP, announced that the State Council declared the contract between the municipality and the tramway and electric lighting company nil and void. he declared that he and his co-MP Sahfīq Bey al-Muʾayyad had sent this news to the people of Damascus (ahl dimashq) some 15 days ago through the parliamentary telegraph office. the weird things is that the news have not yet arrived here and he inquires whether this is a common thing for messages from the delegates of the people (wukalāʾ al-umma).
we thank our friend Rushdī Bey Shamʿa etc.
3hd: we were asked to call the attention of the baladiyya to the al-Shābkaliyya Street (shāriʿ) in al-Qanawāt, which is full of dirt and rubbish and the like.
hd: we received critique from a large crowd of people (jumhūr kabīr min ahālī) of Ṣāliḥiyya concerning the tramway and the fares in their quarter. they saw that the company charges 2 metalliks between the Serai to the end of the Mīdān. but the fare between the Union Square (Sāḥat al-Ittiḥād,Marja Square) and Jisr al-Abyaḍ is also 2 metalliks in the second class even though the distance is only half as long. now they demand a reduction in fares which only increase the profit (rubḥ) of the company. if the company reduced the fare to 1 metallik for the 2nd and 2 metalliks for the 1st class the people of the quarters of al-Akrād, Muhājirīn, Jarākissiyya etc. would, instead of walking, take the tramway in the morning and the evening.

2hd: open letter to the Vali
hd: the municipality and the position of the lamb meat merchants, by "Dimashqī"
- the municipality wants to remove the traders of lamb meat from their traditional location (sūq al-maʿrūf) to the area south of the cemetery of Bāb al-Ṣaghīr as their trade encroaches upon the street and obstructs traffic of coaches and tramways, after it objected to move them to the former location of the dilligence company and al-Zaftiyya
- now the area is important to the Muslim community (umma) and the thousands of graves are not a good environment for selling meat. also the merchants took to building roofs to protect them from the weather and thus encroached upon the property of the neighbours
- graves are mawqūf / mevkuf property and the location is muḥtaram to protect the honour of the dead.
- how can the municipality decide to build there, and how can the majlis al-awqāf permit such grace step. this is against both laws (qanūn) and fatwas

summer is approaching and thus the necessity to consider all necessary cleaning measures for the town and its street. currently the hundreds of new houses in Ṣāliḥiyya (i.e. Muhājirīn) dispose off their sewage into the streets and necessarily also into Ṣāliḥiyya street which is one of the most important alleys (cade / jāda)

3hd, by Bāblī: we heard about shortages of electric light in the town and particularly along the Mīdān road. it was said that this is due to the lack of poles between Qanawāt and the Mīdān, but now it surfaces that light bulbs should be changed every month, which is not done.
Muqtabas 455 had published a warning from the municipality to the company reminding it of its duty to pave the entire distance between the Marja Square and Bāb Miṣr with stones according to art 9 of the statutes (al-sharṭiyya). but nothing had happened and we had reminded the baladiyya of the rights of the people (wa-ṭalabnā minhā mā huwa ḥaqq al-qawm) in No 529 of 18 Dhu I and no. 559 of 26 Dhu II. and we do it again now and point at the rights of the people (ḥuqūq al-ahlīn)

2hd: incident between the commander of the Ḥawrān campaign, Sāmī Pasha, and "out friend" <persName>ʿAbd al-Ḥamīd Efendi al-Zahrāwī</persName>, MP for Ḥamāh
3hd by Sūrī (a Syrian): we had reported in No 646 [Sun, 9 Apr 1911] on the people of Ṣāliḥiyya criticising the tramway company for charging them 2 metalliks for a single second class journey from the Union Square to Jisr al-Abyaḍ. it is said that the company has no interest in the benefit of the people. in Tripoli is a tramway, which operates at much lower fares for even longer journeys. this is due to this tramway being grounded in the people and established as a project under Midḥat Pasha some 30 years ago.
it is even worse as the tramway in Damascus, contrary to the one in Tripoli, is powered by the water of the River Barada at no additional cost to the company. the spirit of insult grows in the Damascenes from day to day and we are afraid that at some point they will take to boycott the tramway and physically attack the passengers. thus we call for a decrease in the fare to Ṣāliḥiyya until the people (ahalūn) are appeased and praise the company. we say the following to our compatriots (al-waṭaniyīn): if a national popular company could have been established 35 years ago by Midḥat Pasha in Tripoli, why can't you do to here etc.
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

1"the municipality of Damascus and the industrial school" (baladiyyat dimashq wa madrasat al-ṣināʾiʿ) by "Sūrī"
3hd: <persName>Monsieur Francou</persName>, agent of the tramway company (in Damascus) in Constantinople, wrote to the ministry of public works on the issue of the tramway line in Damascus between the serai and Bāb Miṣr and to the tomb of Ibn ʿArabī …
1 – building a line from the Serai to Dūmā with a length of 9km without new statutes
2 – constructing a line from the Serai to the Masjid al-Aqṣāb on the condition that the amounts for the necessary expropriations are agreed upon with the authorities
3 – as there is no way to build a line to Bāb Sharqī, the line to Dūmā will start at the Masjid al-Aqṣāb
4 – the line to Muhājirīn will be build instead of the line to Bāb Sharqī (i.e. replacing these lines in the contract/ concession) 5 – that the expropriations along the Ṣāliḥiyya road will be paid for at equal shares by the municipality and the company as agreed upon in the contract signed three years ago.
in response the provincial administration council decided the following
1 – in regards to the concession originally granted to Yūsuf Efendi Muṭrān and then acquired by the company on 29 Jum II 1327 the lines from the Marja to Bawābat Allah , to the tomb of Ibn ʿArabī, and to Bāb Sharqī, from the latter to Dūmā, and from the Marja to Masjid al-Aqṣāb are mandatory. this was confirmed by a letter from the MoPW of 19 Shub 1321, 21 Tam 1325 with the numbers 69 and 44.
2 – to establish the value of real-estate to be expropriated this has to be done according to the laws and the two parties have the right to settle things in court according to art 3 of the law on real-estate and expropriations (qānūn al-amlāk wa al-istimlāk). from this follows that the authorities have no interference in this matter
3 – the construction of the Bāb Sharqī line is mandatory and mentioned in art 1 of the concession
4 – the construction of the two lines from Jisr al-Abyaḍ to the tomb of Ibn ʿArabī and Muhājirīn had already been approved by the provincial administration council and there had been no talk of them substituting the line to Bāb Sharqī
5 – the expropriations along Ṣāliḥiyya road a governed by the respective law and even though the company points to a contract signed with the baladiyya 3,5 years ago, this has no relevance in the face of these laws
these decisions have been forwarded to the MoPW with the demand not to approve any alteration of the original concession and contracts
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

1al-aḥwāl al-ʿāmma

hd: a dead girl had been found in the waters of the River Barada near the 11th mill (maṭḥana al-iḥdā ʿashriyya). from the postmortem it was established that she drowned at least 15 days ago. the body was given to her family for burial

2hd: imperial authorities banned masonic lodges and in fact any secret societies.
3hd: yest eve: election of the new Muftī of Damascus
hd: new newspaper al-bāriqa, calling itself Ottoman political, cultural, historical. published thrice a week on Sat, Mon, and Wed in Damascus. publisher is <persName>Muṣṭafā Shūqī Efendi</persName> and the first bi-lingual number (Arabic and Turkish) appeared yesterday.

3hd: Aḥmad Sharīf is the correspondent of Ṭanīn in Damascus
hd: on the commission for the industrial school / orphanage which enrolled a number of students who had been living on the streets and slept among the dogs (kilāb). 14 of them receive a scholarship paid for from the private pockets of <persName>Muḥammad Pasha al-ʿAẓm</persName>, head of the baladiyya
hd: electors and candidates for the post of the Muftī in Damascus gathered at the Serai for the election
hd: yest was the appointed date of the trial between muqtabas and Nāẓim Pasha, the former Vali of Baghdad [and Syria?]. it was postponed to 21 Ḥaz

3hd: 7 o'clock yesterday; the election for the Muftī in Damascus took place in the presence of 204 electors. Vali called on them to proceed in accordance with the letter of the regulations concerning this election: the person elected must posses knowledge in administration, be of good morals, know Turkish, as he has to deal with officials. <persName>Shaykh ʿAbd al-Qādir al-Khaṭīb</persName> rose and delivered a prayer. The secretary of the provincial administration council administered the election and counted the votes. the electors came form all athmān of the city. the votes cast were as follows:

After the election, the new Muftī <persName>Riḍā Efendi al-Ḥalabī</persName> went to the municipality. While those present signed the ballots, <persName>ʿAbd al-Raḥīm Efendi al-Ṣufuḥ</persName> read from the Quran..
The new Muftī is a noble and honorable man and had been Nāʿib of the Maḥkamat al-Bāb in Damascus
dh: some owners of the orchards discovered and complained the all sorts of youths gather in their gardens and engage in quarrels and exchange of gun fire. some police and gendarmes were finally dispatched.
dh: some people from the quarter of Qanawāt criticise the baladiyya for having done nothing to prevent the Barada flooding their homes for the last two weeks
police news (ḥawādith al-shurṭa):<persName> Hāshim bin Maḥmūd Sayyid</persName>, the guard of Sūq Sārūja (ḥāris rubʿ sūq…) had been arrested for having recently burglarised the shop of <persName>Aḥmad bin Diyab Ṣādiq</persName> from the quarter of Maḥalla al-Samāna

calling for the regulation of prostitution. The article is not to be found on pages 1, 3-4. page 2 is too blurred to be read
3m: the baladiyya published new tariffs for coach drivers etc. but as with earlier reforms this will remain on paper only. one of the reason being that the roads are in such a bad condition that the drivers cannot lower their fares. if the municipality does repair the streets, we will accept the new tariffs, what does it say to that?
4iʿlān: al-tamsīd al-nāfiʿ (beneficial massage), by <persName>Wartha bint al-Ṭurāb</persName>
it is generally known that for decades massages (mihnat al-tamsīd "al-Masāj") had been located in our place in Bāb al-Sarījā. in the view of the death of our mother, we divided the establishment with one part remaining at the old location, the second in Zuqāq Rāmī opposite the Post Office in the house of the Muftī of Baalbek. at the latter location we specialise in the massage of the poor on Sat and Wed. this is announced to the public (al-ʿumūm).

2hd: anniversary of the Sultan's accession to the throne
celebrated today, 15 Nisān 1325.
3hd: the local iʿdādī school has the custom to leave the town in spring for gatherings at the gardens (nazaha). students, professors, staff, and others attend these meetings. this year, they met at the Ṣūfāniyya gardens. they had some gymnastic apparatuses with them, a music band under the leadership of the famous ʿAbd al-Raḥmān Efendi al-Miṣrī. a number of students staged a play of the announcement of the constitution in Turkey [in 1908]
3-4hd: internal statutes of the to the fair liberal party (ḥizb al-ḥurr al-muʿatadal) continuing from earlier number

2-3prison break: last Thu 12:30 in the morning the prisoners broke the metal bars of the prison at the Khandaq opposite the Ottoman Bank (ʿAṣrūniyya). some 27 Druze prisoners fled. ALL NAMED. three of the fugitives were arrested and returned to the prison, ALSO NAMED

1on the parliamentary elections: the imperial government issued orders to the provinces to provide the necessary security measures during the elections
2hd: the court in Trabzon sentenced the Vali of that province to 10 days imprisonment for beating a policeman
hd: article by Shukrī Bey al-ʿAsalī in Tashkilāt on Nūrī al-Shaʿlān and the oddities of history3hd: our fourth year: Muqtabas commences its fourth year of publication today
hd: arrival of the new Vali
- yesterday arrived Nāẓim Pasha, the new Vali of Syria, via a special train at the Baramke station. large reception; detachment of troops, gendarmes, and police both infantry and cavalry. upon the train's arrival, music began to play and salutes were fired. he drove in his private coach between the two lines of people (bayn ṣufūf al-ahlīn) to the New Serai were he was welcomed upon his return. may he stay long.
hd: the gendarmerie and the people (rijāl al-darak wa al-nās)
- yest: when a detachment of gendarmes went to the reception of the Vali, they trampled over a young man near the barracks of Sultan Salīm. first one, then the second, then the third, etc. and if the witnessing people (nās) had not intervened they had continued. they complained (shakū) to the director of police.

2hd: the Sultanic Firman
yest morn: large gathering in front of the Serai in Damascus for the public reading of the firman establishing Nāẓim Pasha as Vali of Syria … NOT READ
hd: majallat al-shaʿb new monthly agricultural, scientific, social, and news journal published in Damascus. Owner is Aḥmad Ḥilmī Efendi al-Khubʿī, editors are the owner and al-Shahābī. It specifically caters to the needs of the al-ʿāmma and differs from all other journals, which are written for the khāṣṣa. focusing on articles that are of use to "our commoners" (ʿāmmatunā), such as agriculture, cattle illness, growing certain plants.
hd: financial calamities in Beirut and Damascus
3hd: lethal tramway accident in the Mīdān: the tram killed Diyab bin Yasīn Kāshūra aged seven from the village of Bayt Saḥm near the al-Jazmātiyya on the Mīdān road.
hd: fire in an oven in Maʾdhanat al-Shaḥm

2hd: on the lethal accident on the Mīdān road report earlier. calling on potential witnesses to come forward. allegedly the driver spoke to an official of the French railway company in clear transgression of the rules prohibiting him from talking to anybody during the journey. … the boy had been crossing the tracks in ignorance of the approaching tramway car.

3hd: example for the fear of the law: <persName>Ṣādiq Efendi al-Mīdānī</persName> had applied for the publication of a newspaper under the name "umm al-kurā" which is one of the names of Mecca. thus it was prohibited in clear contravention of the law, as Ṣādiq Efendi had paid all the fees and their is no regulation against such a name. He suggested to change the ḥarrakāt, but even the printing of the letters "umm al-kurā" was prohibited

2-3hd: municipal elections in Damascus
announcing to the people the dates for voting in Damascus by thamn from 1 till 10 Ādhār. votes will be counted on 11 and 12 in the presence of all people (ʿāmmat al-ahālīn)
muqtabas reminding its readers that the vote is a vote between traditional and electric street lights, as the future members of the baladiyya have to decide about this issue. The people… Sayyid ʿAṭā Pasha al-Bakrī .. seemingly calling on the readers to vote for him as he is not one of those who sell the public benefit (al-maṣlaḥa al-ʿāmma) for his private benefit (al-maṣlaḥa al-khāṣṣa)
3hd: yest, huge party with vast crowds (ijmaʿat al-jumūʿ) at the national gardens (ḥadīqat al-umma) to celebrate famous delegate / representative Shafīq Bey al-Muʾayyad. First speech delivered by the MP Shukrī Bey al-ʿAsalī, second by Shafīq Bey al-Muʾayyad NOT READ
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

2hd: the Christians and Unity (ittiḥādiyya)
hd: today commence municipal elections in Damascus in the thamn of Qanawāt and tomorrow at Sūq Sārūja. some municipal bailiffs keep public order among the people (al-nās) queuing for casting their ballot. we hope that they all keep in mind that reforms and the well-being of the town depends on their decision etc. if they have any critique, now is the time to raise it
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

1hd: telephone connections are completed between the serai, the director of the police, the baladiyya, the gendarmerie, the inspectorate of Ṣāliḥiyya, the police station in Bāb Tūmā, Mīdān, Sūq Sārūja, al-ʿAmāra, Qanawāt, and Shāghūr, the bidāya court , the headquarters of the army, the telegraph offices, all barracks in the town , the public prosecutor , istiʾnāf court, Baramke station, and 16 other relais stations. thus Damascus is a perfectly connected city.
1-2open letter to Nāẓim Pasha, Vali of Syria
2hd: municipal elections
the most important issue in the government of the nation (umma) through the nation by the means of representatives are elections. first of all the people need the rule of law and they themselves will be the governors of their own rights. no one has the power over them but they themselves. this concerns the ruined streets, their cleaning, the provision of street lights, conduct of repairs and reforms.
problem is limited revenues of only £T16.000 but £T20.000 would be needed for necessary repairs …
3hd: crime statistics for Damascus for 1325-1327

- al-Ḍamīr by ʿIzzat Efendi al-Ḥajjāz and Dāwud Ṣadqī Efendi al-Mārdīnī, weekly, sold for one mecidiye in Damascus and 1,25 abroad
- al-Ishtirākiyya by Ḥilmī Efendi al-Fatiyānī, weekly, same price
- al-Aṣmaʿī by Wajīh Efendi al-Kīlānī, Khayr al-Dīn Efendi al-Zarkalī, weekly, 2 mecidiyes through the empire

2hd: the paper "musāwāt" reported that the new law of publications (qanūn al-maṭbūʿāt) prohibits any publications from active soldiers (mutaqāʿadīn min al-ʿaskariyya). under this pretext, the head of the liberty and .. party Ṣādiq Bey was prevented from publishing in newspapers
hd: members of the baladiyya above 100. the baladiyya in üsküp (uskūb) has numerous members older than 100 years, who are listed here
hd: newspapers in Beirut. all newspapers have to submit their daily issue to the EC in the morning, if they fail to comply, they will be banned according to art 8 of the law on publications
- muqtabas: this is not true. art 8 does not mention the EC (al-dīwān al-ʿarafī).

hd: prices of wheat in Damascus
- today the best quality fetches Ps 37 per kile, the good quality fetches Ps 30.
- as there was plenty of rain, harvests will be abundant and we hope that when the new harvests arrive in three or four months, they will be sold at low prices.
- some bakeries, of course, tried to raise prices
3hd: municipal elections
until now, some of the ballot boxes have not been opened. which is due, it is said, that most members of the election committee also sit in the committee for the parliamentary elections (nuwāb al-ḥukūma). Muqtabas suspects a different reason for delaying the counting after the election of MPs, which I did not properly understand

2hd: qānūn al-tajammuʿ al-mawaqqat; from the issue of Taḳvīm-i Veḳāʿī of 5 Ādhār.
- by imperial irade until the new parliament will approve it as a law
art 1: any congregation of people (ijtimāʿ al-nās) in public streets (al-ṭarīq al-ʿāmm) or their ṭawāf, will be called tajammuʿ henceforth
art 2: gatherings in public streets are not allowed to be armed or to disturb general tranquility / order (al-rāḥat al-ʿumūmiyya)
art 3: if an armed gathering takes place in public streets various functionaries and agencies (all named) can and will intervene to stop and end the gathering / disperse the crowd (tafrīq al-mujtamaʿīn)
art 4: those arrested and those who fired at law-enforcement agencies will be prosecuted
art 5: those carrying arms can be punished with 1 month to 1 year imprisonment …
art 6: those who did not carry arms can be punished with 15 days to 6 months imprisonment … increased from 6 months to 2 years in the case of tafrīq
art 7
art 8: if needed, military can be deployed for the dispersal of crowds
art 9 : something on the qānūn al-ijtimāʿ
art 10: this law is enacted by its publication
art 11: enforced by the MoI, MoJ, MoW

<persName>Ṣādiq Efendi al-Qudsī</persName> also received 341 votes [which makes a total of 3487], but the election committee drew lots and ʿAṭā Pasha al-Bakrī was elected. the two first elected lead with such a margin, because they are known as honorable men to the populace (al-shaʿb).

2hd: the baladiyya and demands to pave the road of the Sūq Midḥat Pasha and another one with stones as the merchants in the suqs claim that they pay their dues for the repair of the roofs and the roads
2-3hd: by Bāblī to the baladiyya; on the road between Suwayqa and Bāb al-Muṣalla. lack of attention paid to the lighting and cleaning in the majority of quarters. rubbish gathers everywhere. we need men in the baladiyya who listen to such grievances
four days ago a section of the wires of at least 50m fell onto a public road (ʿalā jādat al-ṭarīq al-ʿumūmī) in Qubbat al-Bayḍā. as it was at night, nobody was hurt.
this morning collapsed three high dwellings and everything inside in Ḥawsh ʿAbdallah al–ʿAlbī in Qubbat al-Bayḍā. people where hurt in this incident and no official showed up. nobody pays attention to the necessary inspections etc.
3hd: a wall in Ḥārat Fawbiq in the Mīdān collapsed and killed someone, calling on the baladiyya to send its engineers on tours of inspection

m: electric lighting and the municipality
- the readers might remember that the municipality and tramway and electric lighting company agreed upon the provision of 2.500 lamps of 16 cd. of the "Fītāl Mitiyālīk" type for an annual payment of £T 3.250 [this is kind of new, as earlier news reported a fee of 3.500].
a commission had been established to investigate this agreement and the accounts of the baladiyya. They decided that first and foremost the lamps along the tramway tracks should be not be part of the contract and to change the contract accordingly.
After consultations with Monsieur Maysūn, the director of the company, he replied that [bad low-resolution scan] the matter depended on the permit to exploit the River Barada in the Wādī Baradā. something on Muḥammad Pasha al-ʿAẓm [president of the municipality]...
the director is of the opinion that the concession grants a right to generate power from the Barada in Wādī Baradā. the municipality disagrees and opines that the water does not belong to him exclusively (al-māʾ laysa min khuṣāṣihā) and wrote a Mazbata to the province …. it was decided that the river is "mamlūk" and that any action interfering with this river will impact on the benefit of its owners (nafaʿ aṣḥābihi) thus changing. the benefit of the owner of the river depends on the profit from the lighting of streets and alleyways with electric lamps.
the solution of this issue depends on the reconciliation with the wellbeing (maṣlaḥa) of the town. we remind out readers that this commission was not established for the repair / reform of the city and the municipality, as some people now claim, because the repair of the town and the municipality is a task of the municipality only ...
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

m: the electric lighting incident (ḥādith)
- ministry: letter from the ministry of public works to the province stating that the company can indeed cut off the light from the municipality
- municipality and light: reported yesterday that the baladiyya had repaired a large number of (gas) lamps and increased that number last night
- ḥādith al-mīdān: some people were affected by the cut of electricity in streets and alleyways and tried in turn to boycott the company and prevent passengers from mountain the tramways. It is said that at half past 12 last night, young men and a women hurled stones at the cars. the demonstration (muẓāhara) stopped at about 3 o'clock, after 42 glass window panes of 12 cars had been smashed. it is also said that two persons were injured, but the police has no information on this matter
- the authorities took the issue seriously and send police and gendarmerie under the command of the director of the police. they arrested 24 persons who are said to be the instigators
- the deputy president of the baladiyya and <persName>Kamāl Efendi al-Muhāyinī</persName>, one of the members, visited the road from the Darwīshiyya to Bawābat Miṣr and admonished the people to remain calm and to abstain from attacking the passengers of the tram
- we say that this quarrel between the municipality and the company, if it is how the ministry of public works claims to be, should be taken to the legal courts (al-maḥākim al-niẓāmiyya). but we … the company should at least light the road of the tramway where the trains run at night, as it is in Cairo.

m: demonstration of the poor against the high prices of bread
yest gather a large crowd (jamm ghafīr) of poor on account of the high price of bread, a raṭl of which reach Ps 4"20. they stage the demonstration and shouted outside the offices of the deputy president of the municipality. after a while, he came out and led the crowd to the offices of the deputy Vali calling for orders to prohibit exports of wheat and flour outside the province. this had been granted by the MoI and the cabinet in Istanbul
took the relevant measures to stop all exports
the baladiyya called on the millers and bakers and extended the pricing of bread and flour. this will inshaallah decrease the prices and ease the fate of the poor who also suffer from the lack of work due to the war-induced recession.
after this was written the baladiyya brought the bakers and millers to set the price of a raṭl of bread to Ps 3"20 to Ps 4 and announced this measure in the Suqs. the bakeries were monitored until everyone adhered to the new prices
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

2m: ḥadāʾith mīdān. follow-up to the last issue
<persName>ʿAlī Efendi al-Ghayrat</persName> and <persName>Riḍā Efendi al-Ṣabbān</persName> are sent to a commission in Beirut for the prosecution of two incidents
1st incident: a small child cursed a woman in the tramway. when three policemen tried to apprehend him he fled into his house/home. they followed him and entered the house without a warrant which is in transgression of the constitution, and the penal code. the boy nevertheless escaped. one of the policemen reported to the director of police and called for a sufficient force to arrest the child, which was granted.
2nd incident: one of the workers of the company rode a tramway car when some children fell upon him and scoffed at him. he tried to punish them but they were protected by the people of the quarter and a quarrel (mushājara) ensued between them and him. the police than arrest some of those who had cursed him among the people. they did so at night, which is again in breach of the law.
the next day hundreds of people from the Mīdān went to the authorities, the police and the Vali and complaint about this transgression.
m: al-muqāṭaʿa
The boycott of the tramway and electric lighting company did not ebb away and the authorities sent a delegation (munādī) to the Mīdān yest morning in order to not incur insults upon those riding the tramways, which only led the boycotting factions (jamāʿat al-muqāṭaʿa) to unite and insist on their demands.
some thought the authorities would enforce a prohibition of the boycott and the merchants of Sūq Midḥat Pasha, the Buzūriyya, and al-Khayyāṭīn closed their shops yesterday morning and called on the gendarmerie to protect their properties.but the director of the police and the commander of the gendarmerie communicated the truth to them and they returned to their business in the afternoon.
they [the boycotters] forwarded new and detailed demands to the province, which will now look into them and there is no doubt that the province will support the baladiyya and act as a single force in this matter and answer the demands of the people (al-ahlīn) in perfect justice until neither the baladiyya nor the company are left in a disadvantage (lā tuẓlimu).
m: muqāṭaʿat al-trām / tramway boycott
today the Vali invited the dignitaries of the Mīdān who represent (mumaththilīn) to negotiate a solution for the tramway boycott. just heard that the company answered some demands. we hope that the boycott will thus soon come to an end and that the rights of the people (ḥuqūq al-ahalīn) will be reinstated

3m: the tramway boycott
yest, meeting of dignitaries from the Mīdān at the serai to negotiate their eight demands upon which Muqtabas had reported earlier. the Vali provided them with an answer to their demands and made some amendments. They left gratefully inclined to his noble judgement, hoping that the promised steps were taken and that, in turn, they would lift the boycott. they commenced by prohibiting any assault on the passengers of the tramway and they took a pause. ... … not understood (blurred copy).
<persName>ʿAlī Efendi al-Ghayrat</persName> and <persName>Riḍā Efendi al-Ṣabbān</persName> were retrieved and they pledged collectively that these two cannot enter the boycott. … thus the end of the boycott is near
m: SUriye: 11 Shub 1328 large fire caused by electric appliances in the house of Saʿīd Efendi al-Ḥijāzī in Qanawāt
m: yest the price of flour (daqīq) fell by Ps 2 for the wazana. now it is Ps 3"60 [which would mean Ps 4"20]
m: also on the boycott. some people of the Mīdān engaged in a boycott of the tramway and electric lighting company. the president of the municipality invited the director of the Company Monsieur Maysūn and the people to forward their demands. These are
1 - stop (tawaqquf) in the question of lowering the subscription fees for electric light and the inspection of the lamps provided to the municipality in the conversion of the Baradā into a private supplier of electricity to the company .. finally the company is ready to negotiate the fees for both the subscribers and the baladiyya
2 - the condition of the Mīdān Road, which by the decision of the company and its director was made into a chaussee that becomes impassable but in summer. the road has to be paved as decided by the provincial administration council and others
3 - a special covered compartment for women must be set up in the coaches. employment of honourable and morally sound staff only.
4 - reduction of speed. if people die, the company has to compensate for it according to the laws and the company should not further delay the implementation of this measure (established by courts)
5 - something on the demand of the company to acquire under-ground properties through expropriations …. we should return to the old ways
6 - nightly tramway services must equal the day schedule
these are the demands presented to the company to be answered to the people of the Mīdān. we call on the authorities to press for a quick solution to this calamity . we also call on the authorities to have the road of the Mīdān paved, either by decision of the provincial administration council or the state council. and this with the highest speed, … the people who do not believe in the boycott today do so like the ones who did so 20 days ago.
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

3m: The Mīdānis and the tramway
The Mīdānis boycott the tramway and their dignitaries met at the municipality and presented their demands on the company which should be achieved through the baladiyya
1- return of the pavement of the Mīdān road in accordance with Sultanic orders
2- reduction in the price of (electric) light to a fair level (bi-ṣūra muʿtadala)
3- a special compartment for women, which cannot be entered by men (and male officials of the company)
4- the speed of the tramway trains shall not exceed a certain level
5- the company starts to offer remittances for injuries inflicted upon persons and animals if they weren't standing or making an error
6- the company will repair all damages of the road caused by the trains
7 - the company shall be obliged to pay for the roofs if it is deemed necessary to heighten the buildings
8 - the subscribers of electricity should be able to buy the electric appliances from any store as is stipulated by law
9 - if the workers of the company have to fix wires and poles facing houses, the mukhtārs of the relevant quarter must be informed beforehand and the baladiyya must inform the owners of the affected houses
10 - timetables and tariffs must be announced in Arabic and Turkish writing
11 - the tramways have to regularly serve the entire course from Ṣāliḥiyya to the end of the Mīdān until two hours past midnight
12 - the company cannot decide where to put up poles or attach wires to houses by itself, but this has to be agreed upon by the baladiyya

these demands have been forwarded to the Vali the meeting was attended by the Sultanic negotiator at the tramway company
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

3extension of the tramway to muhājirīn
yest, some people from al-Muhājirīn in Ṣāliḥiyya called on the baladiyya criticising the tramway company because the latter did not extend the line to the house of Khūrshīd Bey which was established by an imperial irade. the baladiyya already took the necessary measures to enable the company to extend the line to this point for the benefit of the company and the people (li-maṣlaḥat al-shirka wa al-ahlīn). yet the company doesn't listen and doesn't understand that its prosperity depends on the benefit of the people

m: conflict with the company (al-ikhtilāf maʿ al-trām)
the boycott on the tramway and its passengers did not cease in the Mīdān.
the provincial administration council decided to establish a commission comprising <persName>Aḥmad Bey Shamʿa</persName>, <persName>Muḥammad Pasha al-ʿAẓm</persName>, <persName>ʿAbd al-Raḥmān Bey al-Yūsuf</persName>, <persName>Aḥmad Efendi al-Dalālī</persName>, <persName>Muṣṭafā Bey al-ʿĀbid</persName>, <persName>ʿAṭā Efendi al-ʿAjalānī</persName>, <persName>Amīn Efendi al-Tarazī</persName>, the Nāʾib, the Muftī, the deputy president of the baladiyya, and the director of the cadaster <persName>Tawfīq Efendi Shāmiyya</persName> to investigate the matter (masʾala) of the diversion of the River Barada between the Tekkiye and Sūq Wādī Baradā for the generation of electric power as a solution for the conflict between the people and the company and between the municipality and the company.
our view: the life of Damascus depends on these issues. as all Damascenes have a right to a proper life (maṣlaḥa)

3m, by M.D. slashing critique of the provincial and municipal authorities as not working for the benefit of the ordinary craftsmen, workers, people. We have many laws, but none are implemented. taxes and fees are collected but public works and services are neglected etc.
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

1imperial budget for 1912-1913
2m: popular / public coaches (ʿarabāt ʿāmma) on the Mīdān Road.
to compete with the company and to transport passengers along the Mīdān and Ṣāliḥiyya roads, people in the Mīdān collected £T 1.200 for buying and operating coaches. we thank those who contributed.
m: the peasants suffer from the lack of rains
3m: jamʿiyyat al-maqāṣid al-ḥasana
since yest, people of Sūq Sārūja engage in the opening of a ibtidāʾiyya school in their quarter. they found enough people who contribute about Ps 1.000 per month each for the support of the school
m: price of wheat and flour:
did not decreases; some flour merchants met with the deputy president of the municipality yest and claimed that they cannot buy the wheat at cheaper prices and are thus bound to sell at even higher prices. REST IS BLURRED some expression of hopes for improvement
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

2m: the Vali wrote to Constantinople asking for a reply to the reform agenda submitted by the General Council
3m: wheat and flour: on the situation in the Ḥawrān and the supplies of cereals from there
m: the people of the Mīdān established a new benevolent society for educating their children
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

3m: price of wheat currently at Ps 55 - 80 per kile. experts have no doubt that it will soon fall due to abundant harvests in the Ḥawrān
m: ṭarīq masjid al-aqṣāb: we received the critique of a woman who cannot walk the road to the Masjid al-Aqṣāb due to the mud . we join the critique but understood that the baladiyya decided to pave this road. currently preparations are underway to move this project into the realm of real works
ikhṭār to al-Muqtabas: for an article by Dāwud and ʿAbduh from Beirut published in the yesterday's number 1157, who had blamed the author, ʿUmar al-Saʿadī which he is not responsible for.
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

3m: the municipalities and the tasks of the administration, by Ḥomṣī; replying to a report in Suriye 2285 of 21 Mārt 1329 on administrative independence of the baladiyya etc.
- making redress to the law of municipalities as published in newspapers
m: yest died ʿAbdallah Efendi al-ʿAlabī one of the rich of this town, aged 65
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

3m: Muṣṭafā Efendi, engineer at the provincial centre (i.e. Damascus) is appointed to Jerusalem for a salary of Ps 250
m: Jirjī Bey Dīmitrī Sursuq, one of the honoraries of Beirut and dragoman at the German consulate general, died after some sickness
m: the newspaper "Baradā" commenced its second year of publication. congratulations
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

2large one page announcement by the Vali of Beirut, Abū Bakr Ḥāzim: ban on the meetings of the reform party (manaʿ ijtimāʿ al-jamʿiyya al-ʿumūmiyya al-iṣlāḥiyya fī bayrūt wa iqfāl nādīhā)

3muqāṭaʿat al-trām: yesterday met some dignitaries elected by the people of the Mīdān at the baladiyya with the director of the tramway company and its chief engineer and investigated the demands forwarded by the people of Mīdān, foremost among which is the demand to pave the Mīdān road with lubūn [?] or to otherwise match the grand streets of Cairo or other large cities. the company finally agreed to the latter.
these are the statutes agreed upon by the company's director and the president of the municipality.
1 - repair of the road from the station at shaykh Ḥasan to the end of the Mīdān road in Bawābat Miṣr following the example of a paved chaussee matching the road along the Azbakiyya gardens in Cairo.
2 - the removal of rubbish from the tracks is a duty of the company
3 - the two gutters along the side of the road will be repaired
4 - reconstruction of all buildings within 9m of the road is a duty of the company
5 - immediate repair and constant maintenance of the road as agreed upon in the original contract

the director also verbally pledged to sprinkle the road

the also set up a second convention covering the remaining demands of the people of the Mīdān
1 - special coaches for women
2 - repair of ḍamn al-ṭarīq
3 - a lacking ban of the company to affix the electric wires to houses
4 - limiting the speed of the trains to a medium speed
5 - the traffic of coaches on the inclination (? al-mīl)
6 - employment of workers from a pool honorable and morally correct persons

this second contract will be negotiated next week

muqtabas: this is complete victory for the people of Mīdān and the new road of Cairene grandeur will be the first in our town
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

3as in earlier numbers: "the Armenian question" al-masʾalat al-armaniyya
m: Arabic language and the judiciary: some officials of the judiciary do not conduct their work in Arabic despite imperial orders to the contrary
m: the new tramway tracks
the people see that the tramway company builds the new tramway line through places which are not broad enough for doing so under the terms of the contract. it is incumbent on the company if it was to make the people thank them, to broaden and pave the entire way, until they say about it that it is beneficial to the repair of some streets of Damascus … until the people forget how the situation was before the boycott in the Mīdān, namely that it was said that the company destroyed rather than built road.
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

3m: the tramway company and the children
the contract between the company and the authorities stipulates that children accompanying their family do not have to pay the fare. but some employees of the company try to charge such a fare. this often results in verbal quarrels between them and the ladies. we ask the director to reply to these charges
m: al-Amīr <persName>ʿĀrif al-Shahābī</persName> a graduate of the civil high school in Damascus entered legal services as a lawyer

3m: the weekly french-speaking newspaper "bayrūt" is published by Jirjī Bey Ḥafūsh
m: the prison at the citadel is divided into several divisions with different names and governing regimes. some are severely lacking morals and prison riots broke out between the men. FULL DETAILS NOT READ
